reference_a:
@article{hawks2023,
  title = {Accurate prediction of momentary cognition from intensive longitudinal data},
  author = {Hawks, Zoë W. and Strong, Roger and Jung, Laneé and Beck, Emorie D. and Passell, Eliza J. and Grinspoon, Elizabeth and Singh, Shifali and Frumkin, Madelyn R. and Sliwinski, Martin and Germine, Laura T.},
  date = {2023-08-01},
  journaltitle = {Biological Psychiatry: Cognitive Neuroscience and Neuroimaging},
  series = {Reliability of {{Neurocognitive Measures}} for {{Mental Health}}},
  volume = {8},
  number = {8},
  pages = {841--851},
  doi = {10.1016/j.bpsc.2022.12.002}
}

features.name: day
features.coding: Days elapsed in study

features.name: interruptions
features.description:
Did anything interrupt
you during this
assessment?
features.coding:
0 = no
1 = yes

features.name: nervous
features.coding:
Indicate to what extent you felt this way right
before you started this survey.

1 = very slightly or not at all
2 = a little
3 = moderately
4 = quite a bit
5 = extremely
features.wording:
Indicate to what extent you felt this way right
before you started this survey: Nervous.

features.coding:

1 = very slightly or not at all

4 = quite a bit
5 = extremely

before you started this survey: Afraid

features.name: depressed
features.coding:
Since the last survey, how often have you felt...

1 = none of the time
2 = a little of the time
3 = some of the time
4 = most of the time
5 = all the time

features.name: restless_or_fidgety
features.coding:
Since the last survey, how often have you felt...

1 = none of the time
2 = a little of the time
3 = some of the time
4 = most of the time
5 = all the time

features.name: so_sad_that_nothing_could_cheer_you_up

features.coding:

1 = none of the time
2 = a little of the time
3 = some of the time
4 = most of the time
5 = all the time

features.coding:

5 = all the time

features.coding:
Since the last survey, how often have you felt...

1 = none of the time
2 = a little of the time
3 = some of the time
4 = most of the time
5 = all the time

features.name: argument_stress
features.coding:
Since the last survey, did you have an argument or disagreement with someone?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: let_pass_stress
features.coding:
Since the last survey, did anything else happen that you could have argued or disagreed about, but you let it pass?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: friend_relative_stress
features.description: Stressfulness of something happening to a friend/relative
features.coding:
Since the last survey, did anything happen to a close friend or relative that turned out to be stressful for you?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: health_stress
features.coding:
Since the last survey, did anything stressful happen regarding your personal health?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: other_stress
features.coding:
Since the last survey, did anything else happen that most people would consider stressful?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: covid_stress
features.coding:
Since the last survey, how much time did you spend thinking about coronavirus/COVID-19?
If yes, how stressul was this experience?

1 = not endorsed
2 = not at all stressful
3 = a little bit stressful
4 = somewhat stressful
5 = very stressful

features.name: socialfunc_interactions
features.coding:
Since the last survey, about how many times did you talk or communicate with someone
else?

1 = 0 interactions
2 = 1 interaction
3 = 2 or 3 interactions
4 = 4 or more interactions

features.name: alert_sleepiness
features.coding:
Please indicate your
sleepiness during the 5
minutes before this
survey by choosing the
appropriate description.

1 = extemely alert
9 = very sleepy, great effort to keep awake, fighting sleep

features.name: going_on
features.coding:
There is a lot going on
around me right now

1 = not at all true
2 = a little bit true
3 = somewhat true
4 = very true

features.name: concentrating
features.coding:
I am having trouble concentrating right now. 


1 = not at all true
2 = a little bit true
3 = somewhat true
4 = very true

features.name: noisy
features.coding:
I am in a very noisy place right now. 

1 = not at all true
2 = a little bit true
3 = somewhat true
4 = very true"

features.name: finish
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty with following through on instructions and failing to finish things?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: organization
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty with organization?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: mentaleffort
features.description: Avoiding, disliking, reluctantly doing things that require a lot of mental effort
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty with avoiding, disliking, or reluctantly doing things that require a lot of mental effort?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: forgetful
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty with being forgetful?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: fidgeting
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty fidgeting with your hands or feet or squirming in seat?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: motor
features.description: Acting as if driven by a motor
features.coding:
To what extent are you currently having difficulty with feeling “on the go” or acting as if you are “driven by a motor”?

1 = not having difficulty at all
5 = extreme difficulty

features.name: study_time
features.coding: 24 hour clock in local time zone

features.name: sleep_dur
features.coding: Time between typical bed and wake up time

features.name: socialfunc_comp
features.coding: Mean of three social functioning items on a 0-7 scale

features.name: ds_median_r_tc
features.coding: Median reaction time on correct responses

features.name: crt_median_r_tc
features.coding: Median reaction time on correct responses

features.name: gcpt_dprime
features.coding: Accuracy computed as d-prime

features.name: mot_percent_correct
features.coding: Proportion of correct targets
